author: Special Correspondent
text:
Hitting back at Prime Minister Narendara Modi after his recent jibe in Parliament, Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi said on Monday that Mr. Modi and his Cabinet Ministers were free to attack him, but they should stop “crushing the poor who demand their rights.”

“Indulge in much personal attacks as you want. But don’t crush the poor, the weak, for whom I speak. Hit me as much you want. Speak for as long as you want to, but don’t hit the poor people of the country,” Mr. Gandhi said after meeting an Adivasi delegation from Chhattisgarh.

“Tribals from Bastar met me today. They said they are facing atrocities in Bastar and that they are being threatened and crushed,” he said. “The country will not benefit by beating and threatening the people. You pressured Rohith Vemula in Hyderabad. Here you are pressuring Kanhaiya and our students.”
title: Attack me but don’t crush the poor: Rahul
